00037 #ifndef __LIBCFS_LIBCFS_H__
00038 #define __LIBCFS_LIBCFS_H__
00039 
00040 #include <libcfs/list.h>
00041 
00042 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00043 # include <libcfs/linux/libcfs.h>
00044 # include <libcfs/types.h>
00045 # include "curproc.h"
00046 
00047 #define LIBCFS_VERSION  "0.5.0"
00048 
00049 static inline int __is_po2(unsigned long long val)
00050 {
00051         return !(val & (val - 1));
00052 }
00053 
00054 #define IS_PO2(val)       __is_po2((unsigned long long)(val))
00055 #define PO2_ROUNDUP_TYPED(x, po2, type) (-(-(type)(x) & -(type)(po2)))
00056 #define LOWEST_BIT_SET(x) ((x) & ~((x) - 1))
00057 
00058 /* Sparse annotations */
00059 #if !defined(__must_hold)
00060 # ifdef __CHECKER__
00061 #  define __must_hold(x) __attribute__((context(x, 1, 1)))
00062 # else  /* __CHECKER__ */
00063 #  define __must_hold(x)
00064 # endif /* !__CHECKER__ */
00065 #endif /* !__must_hold */
00066 
00067 /* libcfs watchdogs */
00068 struct lc_watchdog;
00069 
00070 /* Add a watchdog which fires after "time" milliseconds of delay.  You have to
00071  * touch it once to enable it. */
00072 struct lc_watchdog *lc_watchdog_add(int time,
00073                                     void (*cb)(pid_t pid, void *),
00074                                     void *data);
00075 
00076 /* Enables a watchdog and resets its timer. */
00077 void lc_watchdog_touch(struct lc_watchdog *lcw, int timeout);
00078 #define CFS_GET_TIMEOUT(svc) (max_t(int, obd_timeout,                   \
00079                           AT_OFF ? 0 : at_get(&svc->srv_at_estimate)) * \
00080                           svc->srv_watchdog_factor)
00081 
00082 /* Disable a watchdog; touch it to restart it. */
00083 void lc_watchdog_disable(struct lc_watchdog *lcw);
00084 
00085 /* Clean up the watchdog */
00086 void lc_watchdog_delete(struct lc_watchdog *lcw);
00087 
00088 /* need both kernel and user-land acceptor */
00089 #define LNET_ACCEPTOR_MIN_RESERVED_PORT    512
00090 #define LNET_ACCEPTOR_MAX_RESERVED_PORT    1023
00091 
00092 /*
00093  * Drop into debugger, if possible. Implementation is provided by platform.
00094  */
00095 
00096 void cfs_enter_debugger(void);
00097 
00098 /*
00099  * Defined by platform
00100  */
00101 int unshare_fs_struct(void);
00102 sigset_t cfs_block_allsigs(void);
00103 sigset_t cfs_block_sigs(unsigned long sigs);
00104 sigset_t cfs_block_sigsinv(unsigned long sigs);
00105 void cfs_restore_sigs(sigset_t);
00106 void cfs_clear_sigpending(void);
00107 
00108 /*
00109  * Random number handling
00110  */
00111 
00112 /* returns a random 32-bit integer */
00113 unsigned int cfs_rand(void);
00114 /* seed the generator */
00115 void cfs_srand(unsigned int, unsigned int);
00116 void cfs_get_random_bytes(void *buf, int size);
00117 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */

00135 int libcfs_ioctl(unsigned long cmd, void __user *uparam);

00137 /* container_of depends on "likely" which is defined in libcfs_private.h */
00138 static inline void *__container_of(const void *ptr, unsigned long shift)
00139 {
00140         if (unlikely(IS_ERR(ptr) || ptr == NULL))
00141                 return ERR_CAST(ptr);
00142         else
00143                 return (char *)ptr - shift;
00144 }
00145 
00146 #define container_of0(ptr, type, member)                                \
00147         ((type *)__container_of((ptr), offsetof(type, member)))
00148 
00149 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00150 
00151 #endif /* _LIBCFS_LIBCFS_H_ */
